definition: thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: First, please study Hiragana and Katakana.
sentences.chinese: 首先，请学习平假名和片假名。

sentences.english: Down with the United Fucking States of America!
sentences.chinese: 片假名，美国，就是这么发音的。

sentences.english: For example, Japanese katakana characters can be written as full-width or half-width.
sentences.chinese: 例如，日语片假名字符可以写为全角或半角形式。

sentences.english: Katakana is mainly used by Japanese for words of foreign origin.
sentences.chinese: 在日语之中，片假名是用来书写外来语的。

sentences.english: There is a Katakana is also very difficult to back ah.
sentences.chinese: 还有就是片假名也很难背啊。

sentences.english: Double - byte or single - byte katakana characters cannot be used for password.
sentences.chinese: 全角或半角片假名字符不能用作密码。

sentences.english: Japanese-English translation must deal with the problem of Katakana reduced to English.
sentences.chinese: 日英翻译需要处理日语片假名的英译还原问题。

sentences.english: True, there isn't any Hiragana and Katakana here, but that is NO REASON to attack her.
sentences.chinese: 没有平假名或片假名在这里，但没有理由攻击她。

definition: reading or phonetic value of a character
false name/pseudonym/alias/pen name/the Japanese kana scripts/hiragana 平假名[ping2 jia3 ming2] and katakana 片假名[pian4 jia3 ming2]
Mandarin phonetic symbols (MPS), phonetic alphabet for Chinese used esp. in Taiwan, also known colloquially as Bopomofo (after the first four letters of the alphabet:ㄅㄆㄇㄈ)
Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s
to indicate the pronunciation of Chinese characters using Pinyin or Bopomofo etc/phonetic notation/(specifically) Bopomofo (abbr. for 注音符號|注音符号[zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4])
native words (i.e. not derived from Chinese, in Korean and Japanese etc)
standard form of a Chinese character/(Tw) traditional (i.e. unsimplified) characters
